summary: This bill, known as the Keeping Official Territories Eligible for Land-use Act (KOTEL Act), aims to repeal a prohibition on using funds for facility construction or development in Israel, Jerusalem, and the West Bank. It effectively removes a restriction on how US funds can be used in these specific geographic locations, impacting the allocation of resources related to site acquisition and construction. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives and referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs.
